abstract_summ: Two hypothetical case studies are solved to illustrate the computational capability of the model, which can generate an allocation plan with outcomes that are superior to simple ad hoc allocation.To quantify the impact of government actions and support existing theories as well as policy makers, a data-driven model is developed.Treating NPIs equally across countries and regions limits the possibility for modelling differences in epidemic response, as the response to the NPIs influences can vary between regions and this can affect the epidemic outcome, so do the strength and speed of lifting these.In response to the pandemic development of the novel coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2), governments worldwide have implemented strategies of suppression by non-pharmaceutical interventions (NPIs).In this paper, a linear programming model is developed to determine the optimal allocation of COVID-19 drugs that minimizes patient fatalities, taking into account additional hospital capacity constraints.
title_summ: The effect of opening up the US on COVID-19 spreadOptimisation of non-pharmaceutical measures in COVID-19 growth via neural networksProcess integration for emerging challenges: optimal allocation of antivirals under resource constraints
title_abstract_phrases: In this paper, a linear programming model is developed to determine the optimal allocation of COVID-19 drugs that minimizes patient fatalities, taking into account additional hospital capacity constraints.The effect of opening up the US on COVID-19 spreadIn response to the pandemic development of the novel coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2), governments worldwide have implemented strategies of suppression by non-pharmaceutical interventions (NPIs).Two hypothetical case studies are solved to illustrate the computational capability of the model, which can generate an allocation plan with outcomes that are superior to simple ad hoc allocation.Optimisation of non-pharmaceutical measures in COVID-19 growth via neural networksThis study seeks to quantify the impact of government actions in mitigating viral transmission of SARS-CoV-2.In particular, useful models can be derived from process integration techniques that deal with tight resource constraints.
